1578154157_16m8gAt3tZc2tssxPz2zzuz873Ez8.body:
> [cupcake](#comment_1_1H4eK5ZTs4ZL3s486bQQPn71qdeQXqKXjK): Another uncensorable P2P net is Freenet. https://freenetproject.org/index.html

Eh...Freenet is more or less not safe these days since a few small-time researchers figured out some form or another to hone in on people if they downloaded previously flagged files, on top if Freenet intentionally not masking the first few jumps into the network so any adversary who was sitting first or so in your travel path would always be able to know what you were looking for (unless you actually had Darknet mode active and actually had trusted peers).

It's also slower than honey sprinting uphill and has a garbage update cycle...

> [fke13](#comment_129_1DZBbYJmuFQvVTe2X2Enrveziw3vN1JQXz): I do not know, but the way I understand, the IPFS is more like an FTP analogue, except that it is using a P2P network. In that case the solution might be some sort of a P2P-email service, where the individual emails form a forum thread.  [...]

Apparently there are already encrypted P2P file sharing and email services running on IPFS.

> [anon05](#comment_36_16m8gAt3tZc2tssxPz2zzuz873Ez8badoP): Can't it be used through Tor?

Not that I recall, no. Something about their communication protocols causing conflicts or something.

1578406050_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body:
Straight garbage. It used to not work AT ALL (to the point where you'd think your were anon but your IP was leaking), then they made it worse with the BS crypto that forces you to become untrusted when you join the network for bad share ratio unless you're an uploader first...and even that barely works.

It's got a good...5 years til it's good or the dev blows his brains out.

1578406618_1HyEXXEZoDTRH1ZgVoZv8QPoGu2e3.body: You can also check by looking at your Notification pane (windows) or whereever it is on Linux for your listed IP : if it's not the IP you have from your ISP, you're connected via Tor. Restart your zeronet bin from time to time to see if you're being placed on different onion routes.

1578439030_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body: SWIFT is on the way out, especially if more banks adopt into the RippleX network where you can transfer funds bank-to-bank nearly instantly so you don't need to wait 3 days for your money.
